alert.note: Alert for Eastern Columbia; Western Columbia; Western Dutchess (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albany (Eastern New York and Western New England)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 28 at 1:17PM EDT by NWS Albany
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Berkshire, north central Dutchess and southern Columbia Counties through 145 PM EDT... At 116 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Clermont, or 10 miles east of Saugerties, moving northeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Copake, Clermont, Ancram, Hillsdale, Taghkanic, Weed Mines, Craryville, Nevis, Silvernails, Jackson Corners, Spaulding Furnace, Copake Falls, Gallatinville, Copake Lake, Manorton, West Taghkanic, West Copake, Snyderville, Mount Ross and Blue Store. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized poor drainage flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: Eastern Columbia; Western Columbia; Western Dutchess
